question: Which one of these is a contraindication for intravenous urography?
Which of these is an absolute indication for surgery in benign prostatic hyperplasia?

answers.option: Urinary retention unresponsive to medical therapy

question: A boy was riding his bicycle when he fell on his stomach. If the point of impact is the epigastric region, which organ is most likely to be ruptured?
In a patient with stage T1 prostatic carcinoma, what is the treatment of choice?
What is the best treatment for benign prostatic hyperplasia with lower urinary tract symptoms?
What is the treatment of choice for posterior urethral valves?
Which one of the following is contraindicated in intravenous pyelography?

Surgical resection of an 8 cm well-circumscribed mass from an infant's abdomen reveals a predominantly solid and pale gray tumor with areas of cystic change, necrosis, and hemorrhage. Microscopically, it is composed of blastemal, stromal, and epithelial tissues. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which one of the following types of kidney stone formation is associated with a bacterial infection?
A patient underwent transurethral resection of the prostate and developed transient stroke and altered consciousness. Which of the following is the probable cause?
Which of the following surgical procedure is preferred for prostatectomy?
An 85-year-old male is diagnosed with renal cell carcinoma. Regarding this, all of the following statements are true except?

answers.option: Following radical nephrectomy, radiotherapy should be given
In 25 percent of cases, there are no local symptoms
Ultrasound and tri-phasic CT urography are imaging methods of choice
It is more common in men
A left sided varicocele may be a presenting feature in males

question: A 70-year-old man, with a history of smoking, complains of hematuria associated with pain in his left loin. He passes clots that are 'worm-like' according to him. On examination, he has an enlarged left kidney with left scrotal swelling. What is the investigation of choice?

A 55-year-old male patient complains of incontinence and lower urinary tract symptoms, predominantly voiding symptoms, for the last several months. On examination, he has suprapubic tenderness. Urine examination shows red blood cells and growth of Proteus and staphylococci. All of these are voiding symptoms except?

A 70-year-old male patient complains of dysuria and lower urinary tract symptoms for several years. On examination, he has suprapubic tenderness. Ultrasound revealed a 60gm enlarged prostate and a 2 cm bladder stone. Which of the following statements is false?

answers.option: Most bladder stones can be treated by minimal access surgery
An oxalate calculus develops in sterile urine
In men, an enlarged prostate and stones can be dealt with at the same time
A uric acid calculus is radio-lucent
Open surgery is indicated due to concomitant bladder stone

question: A 45-year-old male, a recent visitor from Sudan, comes to the emergency with painless hematuria at the end of micturition. Clinical examination reveals no abnormality. On cystoscopy, he is found to have scattered tubercles and islands of pale patches resembling sand. What is the most likely diagnosis?
An 85-year-old male presented with renal cell carcinoma. Which of the following is incorrect?

answers.option: Ultrasound and triphasic CT urography are the imaging methods of choice
It occurs more commonly in men
In 25% of patients there are no local symptoms
A left sided varicocele may be a presenting feature in a male
Following radical nephrectomy, radiotherapy should be given

question: A 22-year-old female presented with a complaint of blood in her urine. What is the initial investigation recommended for this patient?
A 55-year-old male presented with the complaint of painless hematuria, hypertension, weight loss, pyrexia, and anorexia. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 45-year-old female presented with intermittent flank pain and hematuria. She was recently admitted to a hospital for acute pancreatitis. What is the likely cause of her current condition?
A 22-year-old patient with a history of recent travel to Africa is now complaining of fever, abdominal pain, and blood in the urine. What is the most likely cause?

A 70-year-old man who has a history of smoking and complains of hematuria associated with pain in his left groin passes clots that are "worm-like". On examination, he has an enlarged left kidney and scrotal swelling. What is the investigation of choice?

answers.option: Urine detailed report (DR) and culture and sensitivity (CS)

question: A 60-year-old female came with a history of hematuria, dysuria, and troublesome lower urinary tract symptoms. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 70-year-old man is planning to undergo transurethral resection of his prostate. Which of the following complications can arise after the surgery?
A 66-year-old male presents with the complaint of complete anuria and pain in the groin region. X-ray shows a stone below the level of the ureters. What would be the diagnosis?

answers.option: Hydronephrosis due to bilateral partial obstruction
Hydronephrosis due to unilateral partial obstruction
Hydronephrosis due to impaired vesicoureteral reflux
Hydronephrosis due to bilateral complete obstruction
Hydronephrosis due to unilateral complete obstruction
